fields.Video Description: Recorded in Bad Oeynhausen, Germany. German is spoken by more than 100 million people worldwide, enjoying official status as a national language in six countries ‚Äî Germany, Belgium, Liechtenstein, Luxembourg, Austria, and Switzerland ‚Äî and a minority language in 11 more, including Brazil and Namibia. An Indo-European language, German is closely related to geographical neighbors such as Bavarian and Dutch, while also sharing distant ties to over 400 others, including Farsi, Kurdish and Hindi. Read more on Wikipedia: http://bit.ly/1N5fsnK.
italki call to action: Get a free German, Standard lesson with italki: http://promos.italki.com/wikitongues_deu
Demographics: 69,800,000 in Germany (ELDIA 2012). Population total all countries: 78,245,280. L2 users: 8,000,000 in Germany (ELDIA 2012).
YouTube License Statement: This video is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 4.0 International license. To download a copy, please contact hello@wikitongues.org.
fields.Geneaology: "[ Indo-European, Germanic, West, High German, German, Middle German, East Middle German ]"
